text: Foreign Affairs: Scourge of the Han
Foreign Affairs: The King of Yan
Practically, you are a nobody, your fancy titles mean little to the people beyond the borders.
The biting of your neighbors and barking at Han officials have won you few favors among the other warlords. Many consider you just another rebel. One day, they'll see, they'll all see...

War can make strange bedfellows, but in trying times, an enemy's enemy can be a keen ally. You have opened your gates and markets to foreign tribes, and information, goods and culture are freely exchanged. Far off ministers and officials may click their tongues in disgust, but why should a tiger pay heed to the clucks of chickens?

You will carve out your own destiny, and your own path, with your own hands. The barbarians have taught you much, and their ways of war are effective in their brutality. Those nobles who looked down on you, the scholars who mocked you, the warlords who dismissed your relevance - all of them will be brought to heel. Those myriad bandits and tribesmen, once so divided, are now under a single banner - yours. The time is approaching.

Judgement has come for your foes. A new dynasty and a new world will be forged, one carved by your own blade. Meek governors surrender their lands to you lest they face your wrath. Mewling warlords bow their heads rather than raise armies against you. Tribal chiefs, bandit princes and foreign kings submit to you, offering you tribute and soldiers. The era of the Han will end, and history will be rewritten.
[[b]]Foreign Affairs[[/b]] can be increased by battle against Han factions and buildings.
[[b]]Foreign Affairs[[/b]] can be decreased by battle against non-Han factions and buildings.
